p: The average egg production during the entire experiment (6 weeks) was almost similar in females fed with P. abies (0.94 eggs per female per day) and P. sylvestris, where average number of eggs per female per day reached 0.89. Six times lower values (RM ANOVA, p < 0.0001) were recorded in L. decidua and P. menziesii, 0.15 and 0.13 eggs per female per day, respectively.
